sentence.Network_en: We concluded that normal huntingtin works as a lifesaving protein for neurons.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的结论是:正常的杭丁顿蛋白是神经细胞里救命的蛋白质.

sentence.Network_en: All of it has been accompanied by hope for a lifesaving transplant.
sentence.Network_cn: 这一切,都是伴随着那会带来生命希望的移植手术.

entry.def: A life-saving drug, operation, or action is one that saves someone's life or is likely to save their life.

example.tran: 抗生素之类的救生药物

example.ex: She decided her child should go to America for life-saving treatment.
example.tran: 她决定把孩子送到美国去接受可能挽救生命的治疗。

entry.def: You use life-saving to refer to the skills and activities connected with rescuing people, especially people who are drowning.

example.ex: She teaches swimming, lifesaving and water aerobics.
example.tran: 她教授游泳、救生术和水中有氧运动。

means.word_mean: 1. saving the lives of drowning persons;

auth_sentence.content: Any social unrest will hinder cholera victims from receiving lifesaving treatment.
auth_sentence.res_content: Any social unrest will hinder cholera victims from receiving lifesaving treatment.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Any social unrest will hinder cholera victims from receiving lifesaving treatment.

auth_sentence.content: There are many contexts in which smart technologies are unambiguously useful and even lifesaving.
auth_sentence.res_content: There are many contexts in which smart technologies are unambiguously useful and even lifesaving.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There are many contexts in which smart technologies are unambiguously useful and even lifesaving.

auth_sentence.content: That is just in the West, however, in many parts of the world access to lifesaving treatments remain woefully poor.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: That is just in the West, however, in many parts of the world access to lifesaving treatments remain woefully poor.
